name: electricity, high voltage, import from BR-Southern grid | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21120/documentation

This dataset represents the amount of imported electricity from id to AR. The import value includes all electricity imports, independently whether used within the importing country, or re-exported. For a discussion of different ways of modeling electricity trade in LCI, please refer to (Itten & Frischknecht 2012).;For structural reasons of the ecoinvent database the annual import volume is set to zero in this dataset. The import volume is considered directly in the respective high voltage electricity market of the importing geography.

This activity represents the point of 'handing over' the electricity from one country to the other at the border.

This dataset doesn't include any electricity losses or transmission infrastructure as these are accounted for in the market datasets
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2014.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The origin (thermal or hydro) of the imported electricity from Brazil to Argentina varies with the season. Since the amounts of electricity imported from Brazil during 2014 are distributed over many months of the year, the import was modelled as Electricity market, high voltage, BR. Source: SÍNTESIS DEL MERCADO ELÉCTRICO MAYORISTA DE LA REPÚBLICA ARGENTINA - Diciembre 2014. http://www.cnea.gov.ar/Sintesis-mercado-electrico-mayorista. Comisión Nacional de Energía Atómica. Enero de 2015
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: This dataset represents the net amount of imported electricity from Brazil during 2014. The reported amount includes the netl electricity imports, independently whether used within the importing country, or re-exported.
